Rich,

It's probably one of them modern high-end tsuba for iai-to, like the ones
sold here:

http://japanesesword.net/jpn/misc/tsuba.html


Someone recently listed on eBay this tsuba with matching fuchi/kashira, and
claimed them to be from the Edo period.  The set sold for close to $500.00,
as I recall:

http://japanesesword.net/image/misc/tko106.gif

Caution, caution.....


Mike Y.



At 21:39 2003/11/28 +0800, you wrote:
>Hi mike,yes I was just looking at the others and wondering how they could
all look the same, as in age, quality ect without being modern. These would
easily fool a new collector I feel, They look to be fairly well made at
first glance, probably second glance as well.
>
>cheers

>Rich
